titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Indic 26: Pravacanasāroddhārasūtra

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Indic 26: Pravacanasāroddhārasūtra are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: 150 leaves foliated 1-150, upper left and lower right verso.

Mistakes covered over in yellow or blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout; vertical margins marked with quadruple black line.
Formerly housed as Ms. Coll. 390, Item 3001.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Work on Jaina doctrine (including cosmology, tīrthaṅkaras, siddhis, and asceticism), with an unknown line by line commentary in Gujarati between the lines of Sanskrit text. Manuscript contains a number of tables and paintings on Jain subjects, but also includes paintings typical of Rajasthan, such as a horse rider.

msItem.title: Pravacanasāroddhārasūtra
प्रवचनसारोद्धारसूत्र
msItem.colophon: Colophon: iti śrīpravacanasāroddhārasūtraṃ saṃ[vat] 1709 śrāvaṇavadi 7 ravaujālseradurgośreyo 'stu // (f. 150r).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by the art historian and University of Pennsylvania professor Stella Kramrisch and sold to the university on April 6, 1959 (notes accompanying manuscript).
